text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a smoked salmon dill eggs
benedict it doesn't have hollandaise
sauce that has all the flavor all the
excitement all the thrills yet like a
thousand less calories or so I'm not
gonna count life is too short to worry
about shortening your life all right so
all hollandaise is is lots of butter and
egg yolks so what we're gonna do we're
still gonna have butter but we're gonna
use a flavored compound butter on the
English muffin and a compound butter is
just a butter to which you add other
flavorings in this case some fresh lemon
zest some black pepper some cayenne
pepper of course and then some fresh
herb I'm gonna go with dill and I'm not
even gonna chop it I'm just gonna pick
off little pieces of those delicate
leaves you could chop it you could mince
it up but I kind of want to let the
flavor be released when I bite into it
just a little different philosophy I've
done it both ways and this is all to
taste okay I'll give you amounts but
really you put as much as you want so
I'm gonna just kind of pinch off a
couple tablespoons of fresh dill the
butter was room-temperature give that a
good mix and that is ready you can
refrigerate it you can make that a head
or just leave it soft like that so
you're ready to serve to put this eggs
benedict together I'm gonna toast some
English muffins do yourself a favor and
your guests don't use some kind of
hearty pie brand wheat whole grain
flaxseed muffin use a plain white
English muffin you want something very
neutral so toast those well and then
give it a generous spread with your
compound butter all right so I'm gonna
spread my dill butter on there and I'm
not gonna be that shy I'm gonna put
maybe a teaspoon on each which may sound
like a lot but compared to a hollandaise
where you're getting maybe three or four
tablespoons of butter in a serving this
is nothing so relax once the butter
spread on there I'm gonna top that with
some smoked salmon go to a nice deli
that has the real stuff and you don't
really need that much so just one single
layer I think is plenty all right so our
base is ready and of course since you
watched our how to poach eggs demo you

some warm water when they're heated
through you're gonna give it the old tap
a tappa I'm
Rag place them on your smoked salmon
maybe a little bit more Cayenne
maybe a little more dill on top so
people know what they're eating and then
why this works and I said it before all
hollandaise is is lots of butter and
lots of egg yolks okay so luckily we
have that right on our plate the butter
is under the salmon I'm still gonna get
that richness that beautiful dill butter
flavor and the yolk comes with the egg
so real eggs benedict is kind of
redundant you have a yolk popped
underneath and then you have more butter
and yolk on top okay if you take a bite
of that and you got that dill butter and
you got that hot runny yolk and you got
that lemon zest that we put in the
butter and that slightly salty smoked
salmon that is an amazing bike and
nobody's gonna miss the hollandaise
trust me
do I like hollandaise sure do I eat eggs
benedict of course but once in a while
this style is fine there's nothing wrong
with this okay this certainly is not too
high of food it's still very rich very
delicious it just doesn't have like I
said that extra four tablespoons of
butter and egg yolk on top so I hope you

com for more information and as always
enjoy
